item.title: The first room-temperature ambient-pressure superconductor?
item.description: - Scientists have potentially discovered the first room-temperature ambient-pressure superconductor.

item.title: Got called to a professor's office after a complaint his SPARC4 was running slow
item.description: - A professor's SPARC4 computer was running slow, and it was discovered that the slowness was caused by a prank where a grad student ran a program called xroach, resulting in a black square filled with multiplying roaches under the professor's window.

item.title: Mozilla Standards Positions Opposes Web Integrity API
item.description: - Mozilla opposes the Web Environment Integrity API proposal because it goes against their principles and vision for the web.

item.title: At this company, we are family
item.description: - The letter is about a family discussing the current economic conditions and making difficult decisions, including terminating one of their family members (Timmy).

item.title: Show HN: Invoice Dragon – An open source app to create PDF invoices
item.description: - Invoice Dragon is an open source app that allows you to create PDF invoices and receipts quickly and easily.

item.title: Apple already shipped attestation on the web, & we barely noticed
item.description: - Apple has already implemented a system called Private Access Tokens on their devices, which limit access to features and sites based on whether the client is approved by a trusted issuer.

item.title: Guide to running Llama 2 locally
item.description: - A comprehensive guide to running Llama 2 locally, a new language model that does not require an internet connection.

item.title: OpenAI shuts down its AI Classifier due to poor accuracy
item.description: - The post does not contain any meaningful content or vital information.

item.title: PRQL: Pipelined Relational Query Language
item.description: - PRQL is a modern language that can be used as a replacement for SQL, with support for variables and functions.

item.title: Remote work on HN: Who is hiring? – 69% jobs in 2023 are remote
item.description: - The percentage of remote work positions on HackerNews has been steadily increasing since 2018, with a significant surge observed in 2021.
